Content:: This article documents the chronology and epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2 in March 2020, the virus which causes the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and is responsible for the COVID-19 pandemic. The first human cases of COVID-19 were identified in Wuhan, Hubei, China, in December 2019. WHO Situation Report 41:[1] WHO Situation Report 42:[12] WHO Situation Report 43:[26] WHO Situation Report 44:[35] WHO Situation Report 45:[43] WHO Situation Report 46:[52] WHO Situation Report 47:[60] WHO Situation Report 48:[65] WHO Situation Report 49:[71] WHO Situation Report 50:[77] WHO Situation Report 51:[86] WHO Situation Report 52:[98] WHO Situation Report 53:[106] WHO Situation Report 54:[126] WHO Situation Report 55:[136] WHO Situation Report 56:[141] WHO Situation Report 57:[147] WHO Situation Report 58:[152] WHO Situation Report 59:[164] WHO Situation Report 60:[172] WHO Situation Report 61:[179] WHO Situation Report 62:[183] WHO Situation Report 63:[188] WHO Situation Report 64:[192] WHO Situation Report 65:[196] WHO Situation Report 66:[201] WHO Situation Report 67:[203] WHO Situation Report 68:[212] WHO Situation Report 70:[214] WHO Situation Report 71:[217] The list of countries and territories that confirmed their first cases during the period of March 2020: By the end of March, only the following countries and territories had not reported any cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections: Africa Asia Europe North America and the Caribbean Oceania South America
Title: Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in March 2020 - Wikipedia
